meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of slush
meanings.sent1: The sidewalk was slushy after the snow melted.
meanings.sent2: Her boots were slushy from walking through the wet snow.
meanings.sent3: The slushy ground made it tricky to walk without slipping.
meanings.sent4: The slushy snow looked like a giant slushie spilled on the street.
meanings.sent5: The slushy ice was a slippery mess to navigate.

meanings.definition: A drink made of crushed ice and flavored syrup
meanings.sent1: I ordered a slushy to cool down on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The kids enjoyed sipping on their colorful slushies.
meanings.sent3: The slushy was so cold, it gave me brain freeze!
meanings.sent4: The slushy in my cup was a rainbow of fruity flavors.
meanings.sent5: The slushy was the perfect treat for a summer afternoon.

meanings.definition: A mixture of rain and snow
meanings.sent1: The weather forecast predicted a slushy mix for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: We woke up to a slushy mess outside our window.
meanings.sent3: The slushy falling from the sky made everything wet and cold.
meanings.sent4: The slushy on the ground turned the roads into slippery paths.
meanings.sent5: The slushy mix of rain and snow created a winter wonderland.
